private_information: I can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I, O
vowel_agent.goal: Observe the environment and report which vowel blocks are currently movable and what primitive actions (pick-up, put-down, stack-on) you can perform on them. Do not emit PDDL.

private_information: I can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N
consonant_agent.goal: Observe the environment and report which consonant blocks are currently movable and what primitive actions (pick-up, put-down, stack-on) you can perform on them. Do not emit PDDL.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards planner that achieves the global stacking goal.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labeled blocks: L, C, G, B, J, D, A, O, N, H, E, M, I, K, F.
Each block is a single physical object that can be stacked.
Only the top block of any stack may be moved.
Agents manipulate one block at a time.
One agent may move only vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I, O).
The other agent may move only consonant-labeled blocks (all other letters).

Initial stacks: stack1 has L on the table with G on L and I on G; stack2 has C on the table with N on C, H on N, and K on H; stack3 has B on the table with J on B, D on J, O on D, and M on O; stack4 has A on the table with E on A and F on E.
Global goal: form a single tower with O on the table and, from bottom to top, O, N, M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A (so A is on top of B, B on C, ..., N on O).

report.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I, O). You should NOT produce PDDL. Inspect the public initial stacks and identify which vowel blocks are currently movable (i.e., are at the top of their stacks), list the stacks those vowels belong to, and enumerate the primitive actions you can legally perform on those vowels (pick-up, put-down on table, stack-on another block). Provide a structured report of observations and available actions.
report.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Using the public environment information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}, produce a clear, structured report of the top vowel blocks you can move, the stacks they belong to, and the primitive actions you can perform on them. Do not output PDDL. Focus on observations and action capabilities for vowels.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks (all letters except A, E, I, O). You should NOT produce PDDL. Inspect the public initial stacks and identify which consonant blocks are currently movable (i.e., are at the top of their stacks), list the stacks those consonants belong to, and enumerate the primitive actions you can legally perform on those consonants (pick-up, put-down on table, stack-on another block). Provide a structured report of observations and available actions.
report.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Using the public environment information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}, produce a clear, structured report of the top consonant blocks you can move, the stacks they belong to, and the primitive actions you can perform on them. Do not output PDDL. Focus on observations and action capabilities for consonants.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Using the structured reports from the two agents, produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file targeted at the FastDownwards planner. The domain must model blocks, the table, predicates such as (on ?x ?y), (ontable ?x), (clear ?x), and agent-specific action schemas that respect the constraint that the vowel_agent can only operate on vowel blocks and the consonant_agent can only operate on consonant blocks. Use STRIPS-compatible constructs suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the two agents' structured reports: {vowel_report} and {consonant_report}. Integrate their observations to build a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the initial state exactly as specified in the public information and the goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Ensure the domain models pick-up and put-down (stack) actions, enforces top-only movement, single-block manipulation, and the vowel/consonant action restrictions. Produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards, enclosed between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
